Tregua is the seventh album by Renato Zero, published in 1980.
In this double-disc (the first of his career), Renato Zero demonstrates the achievement of artistic maturity. Dedicates to his father Domenico Fiacchini that made him be born and grow up free. It touches the most diverse subjects, from religion to "It could be God (Potrebbe Essere Dio)," gay pride "Wave gay (Onda Gay) " in the hunt "Do not shoot!" Without abandoning his usual irony in songs like "Perfumes, toys and maritozzi (Profumi, Balocchi e Maritozzi)" and "Love, yes, love no (Amore si, Amore no) " Dedicates a song to the universe of adolescents with "For you (Per te) ", while "Ask for more (Chiedi di piu') " urges us not to give away for a while. "Blessed are you (Beati Voi) " speaks of its whited sepulchers, hypocrites. Great success of the album is "Friend (Amico) ," written by Dario Baldan Bembo part of the flagships of Renato Zero.
